metadata.title: CVE-2023-52628 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nftables: exthdr: fix 4-byte stack OOB writeIf priv->len is a multiple of 4, then dst[len / 4] can write pastthe destination array which leads to stack corruption.This construct is necessary to clean the remainder of the registerin case ->len is NOT a multiple of the register size, so make itconditional just like nft_payload.c does.The bug was added in 4.1 cycle and then copied/inherited whentcp/sctp and ip option support was added.Bug reported by Zero Day Initiative project (ZDI-CAN-21950,ZDI-CAN-21951, ZDI-CAN-21961).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1124.130').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1').
